data.title: RA Normal and Turtle AIs try to build sub pen/ship yard when no water nearby
data.body:
The AI doesn't check for nearby water before starting to build them, leading to an infinite "try to place it - fail - try again after 5 seconds" loop.

As AI has some trouble handling water units properly anyway, the easiest "fix" for the time being would probably be to disable water production buildings (and units) for Normal and Turtle AI (Rush AI already doesn't use them). This would probably improve overall performance and efficiency of these two AIs until this is fixed properly.

data.title: Fixed music and video leaking after world disposal
data.body: Closes #8559.

data.title: Added multiplier modifier traits, removing GainsStatUpgrades, InvulnerabilityUpgrade, & Invulnerable.
data.body:
A branch I created about 7 months ago and just rebased.

Adds:
- DamageMultiplier
- FirepowerMultiplier
- InaccuracyMultiplier
- ReloadTimeMultiplier
- SpeedMultiplier
- PowerMultiplier

Removes as redundant:
- Invulnerable
- GainsStatUpgrades
- InvulnerabilityUpgrade

This should remove GainsStatUpgrades bug(s) by simply replacing it.

data.title: AI on bleed builds power plants too late
data.body: Since the `BaseBuilder` was extracted from `HackyAI`, apart from the very first power plant it far too often only builds a new plant when it is already out of power due to a different structure it just built. At the very least we should re-introduce some kind of `MinimumExcessPower`.

data.title: AI has trouble finding coarse attack location for paratroopers
data.body: I get this reproducably in the bot debug messages in RA if there's an AI with soviet paratroopers.

data.title: Tesla boost for RA2 mod
data.body:
Functionality needed for the RA2 mod. Also described in #2330

Introduces a new upgrade called `tesla`. Its consumers would be
- `RequiresPower` that would disable itself (thus not necessitating power for proper functioning of the actor) when enough `tesla` upgrades  have been granted
- `Armament` that would increase range, damage and reload speed and modify rendering for a juiced-up tesla coil

Normally tesla coils would use these traits.

The upgrade's provider would be the `TeslaBoost` activity which requires the actor, that wishes to use this activity, to have the `GivesTeslaBoost` trait. Normally, tesla tanks and tesla troopers would use this trait.

I've tried to make things flexible by allowing
- the modders to decide whether or not `GivesTeslaBoost` activates the `TeslaBoost` when the units are idle in the vicinity of a receiving tesla coil
- the player to force the tesla boost by explicitly giving an order to a tesla tank or tesla trooper to target a particular tesla coil
- the `TeslaBoost` activity to be used with mobile units

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5747153/8380918/78835298-1c20-11e5-8a50-dbe2d0632432.png)

data.title: Refactors the music player.

Proper fix for #8559.
Closes  #8671, #8587 and #8033.

<del>ATM it has one regression: due to the playlist getting set up before the shellmap's lua scripts, the game plays a maximum of two seconds maybe before the shellmap music at game start, depending on settings. That will probably need a StartingMusic trait.</del>

data.title: Fix accessing a disposed world when music ends after changing maps
data.body:
Fixes #8559.

EDIT by @penev:
This is in fact a bandaid for the crash in #8559 for the sake of getting a playtest moving. The code being changed here is still a remnant of the previous world, running in the new one, which is conflicting with the recently introduced world disposing.

data.title: Bleed TD crashes due to the Media.PlayMusic Lua script
data.body:
This seems to be a regression of #8529 due to PlayMusic bleeding into a skirmish game.

Practically, if one has shellmap music - map1.aud, part of transit.mix - then after starting a skirmish game, the player must skip a track manually otherwise the game crashes when map1.aud ends.

data.title: Dispose of a MemoryStream in PackageEntry Take 2
data.body: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8501

data.title: Removed RenderHarvester, RenderLandingCraft and RenderUnit
data.body:
With this PR, `RenderUnit` and its childs are finally removed.

Replaces `RenderHarvester` with `WithHarvesterAnimation`, and `RenderLandingCraft` with `WithLandingCraftAnimation`, and removes all remaining usages of `RenderUnit` as well as the trait itself.

Additionally fixes the namespace of `WithAttackAnimation` and the name of `WithHarvestOverlay` (used by d2k and TS harvesters).

data.title: Break down spritesheets into individual graphic files?
data.body:
This is more of a proposal than an issue. It's hard to explain in text, pardon if it's unclear...

What if, instead of putting all the graphics on spritesheets, such as that of UIbits and other non-SHP graphics, make each individual graphic their own file?

Looking at the UI chrome, there is a lot of picking out graphic WxH and X/Y values off of one sheet.

One downside I can think of to doing this is the extra memory and resources needed to manage every single graphic, but I think as far as modding goes, it is a lot more direct.

For example, the factions played, right now, can share the same infantry/vehicle/aircraft/etc icons off of the same sheet. I can even make separate sheets for the factions. To label each of those icons on the team's chrome, I'd refer to a coordinate on the sheet, and a specific width/height amount of pixels for it to fit.

Using individual graphics files, I can either select the very one I'll draw onto, or if I want to resize it for a custom UI, I can, and in a Trait, point out which file I want to use, and its width/height.

So, if I want a different icon for each team, I make another graphic of that icon, relabel both the file and the Trait definition in the chrome, and it will read specifically the image.

data.title: Starting spec
data.body:
It would be nice for new players and vets alike to have a 10s spec at the start of the match to see the map and chat with players. 

As a toggleable option (enabled by default) a match starts paused with the entire map revealed. A visual timer audibly counts down from 10 to 0 at which point the camera snaps back to your MCV, the shroud cloaks as usual and the 'battlefield control initialised' sound plays.

There is nothing more frustrating than playing a new map and realising it's tiny and that your initial build order has just doomed you or that you placed your REF by some ore without a mine because you couldn't make out the minimap in the lobby.

data.title: Make all of mininuke's SpreadDamage warheads affect the parent
data.body: Fixes #7327 again.

data.title: Bogus use of Map.TopLeft and .BottomRight in mission scripts
data.body:
Queries like `Map.ActorsInBox(Map.TopLeft, Map.BottomRight, function(self) ... end)` are used through most of our map scripts as a method of finding the actors in a map that match an arbitrary filter.

This is bogus for two reasons:
- It abuses an API designed for one thing (finding the actors within a specific part of the map) to do something something completely different (finding all the actors on the map matching a condition).  This is a design smell.
- It doesn't work in TS or RA2 (or any other mods that decide to use terrain height).  The top and bottom edges of the map are not lines of constant WPos.Y, and so you will miss actors near the top of the map if they are at a lower elevation than the top-left cell, and miss actors at the bottom edge of the map if they are at a higher elevation than the bottom-right cell.
- (bonus point) The implementation of `.TopLeft` and `.BottomRight` is basically completely bogus, and returns the wrong points for isometric maps.  We can fix this at least, but its not clear whether these positions are actually useful to scripters after we fix the above two points.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/22842528-bogus-use-of-map-topleft-and-bottomright-in-mission-scripts?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Utility doesn't save file if user doesn't have write access
data.body:
When OpenRA.Utility.exe is in a directory where the user doesn't have write access, such as C:\Program Files (x86)\, the command --generate-dps-table (and possibly others) doesn't produce an output file and the program doesn't show any errors. In this case it is necessary to open the command line with administrator privilages.

It should show a permission denied error. Or maybe put the output file in the directory where all the replays and logs are located...

data.title: Utility gets rotations inverted by Y-axis
data.body:
Hi guys, while converting maps from original soviet RA campaign I noticed a lot of units facing walls and stuff. The problem is apparently in the utility, which converts the rotations badly. In two screenshots, there is original map shown in RAED with correct rotations, and then screenshot of unchanged converted map. You can see that for example harvester remains same, facing down, while the units near the wall completely change direction left to right, and those facing SW now face SE and reverse.

![openra 2015-06-22 19-14-39-64](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12610736/8288055/f22dae96-1913-11e5-836b-0df5bdaf8ac0.png)
![bez nazvu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12610736/8288056/f2301848-1913-11e5-9be9-8f20371ef249.png)

data.title: Ctrl–# Shortcuts Are Not Keyboard Layout Agnostic
data.body:
The issue I am facing is twofold.

(a) First, when launched (on _Ubuntu_) with a Lithuanian keyboard layout, which I use as a default, OpenRA does not allow me to make use of the Ctrl–# unit selection shortcuts. This is because the layout in question, in contrast to the en-US layout, has letters (like ąčęėšųūž) on the digit-key row. Other keyboard shortcuts (W, R, Ctrl-X and so on) work fine – probably because the lt-LT layout has no other special characters aside from the digit-key row.

It could be noted that changing the layout (via a keyboard shortcut) while in game does not work, for OpenRA just stops responding.

(b) This leads to my second issue. Namely, when one launches the games with the layout now changed to the international en-US, one finds Ctrl–# shortcuts working just fine. However, the problem is that the other keyboard shortcuts have stopped working, i.e. W, R, D, G, Ctrl-X and many others. Fixing it requires manual key reassignment, which leads to some keycodes being shown instead of the proper keys, i.e. '1074' instead of 'W' and '1086' instead of R, and so on. Once reassigned, the keys work fine; this is very annoying, though.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/22736903-ctrl-shortcuts-are-not-keyboard-layout-agnostic?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>
